name: Karri Valley Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and myself booked a chalet for a couple of nights away to relax and unwind, arriving Monday and staying until Wednesday.
reviews.title: Relax among the trees.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort itself is very easy to find, and is a nice drive out to as it is about 22k out of Pemberton. While we thought this might have been a downside, we found that it being away from the majority of tourist places was quite good from a business point of view.
reviews.title: shabby and old
Loved the place: "It's worth it"
reviews.text: Driving into the resort presents a nice view of the green paddocks and also the lake. The paddocks at the time were filled with emus and kangaroos grazing on the grass, a nice touch for overseas visitors.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in was easy, the staff were very helpful and pointed out all relevant issues we needed to know. The rooms were quite spacious, the living area of the chalet we stayed in was fantastic and didn't really lack anything. Great view of the lake from our balcony & bedroom window, and while being across the road from the resturaunt and rooms, was very quiet and tranquil.
reviews.title: The most wonderful way to renew ourselves, by the Lake, amongst the Karri trees.

reviews.text: Couple of small points for the room-
reviews.title: ripped off at Karri Valley

likes.liked: — staff were friendly, this was the only positive
likes.disliked: — extremely high priced for very basic run down accommodation and facilities

reviews.text: I think it is important to specify that this is not a resort as such - Karri Valley Resort is more a caravan park with hotel style rooms. First of all, the fact that it calls itself a resort is fairly generous. Of course the surroundings are brilliant: the Pemberton forest is astounding, the water is clear and clean, the wildlife is amazing.
reviews.title: Suitable for where it is...
worst experience
reviews.text: But this is not a resort.

But it is in Pemberton, and although that may seem like a slur, it is not. Pemberton is rustic, historic and wonderfully rough around the edges. And so is Karri Valley Resort. To be honest, I will always go back to Karri Valley for the lake alone, as the fishing, swimming, sailing and the view from the restaurant are second to none and JUST PLAIN FUN.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised

reviews.text: It’s not for the accommodation.
reviews.title: An old favourite
Relaxing Time
reviews.text: The accommodation is below average.
Rubbish everywhere.
reviews.title: Worst service and quality in Western Australia

reviews.text: Rude staff.
reviews.title: Loved the place
Best Holiday Destination Ever!!
reviews.text: Dirty accomadation.
No care for the environment.
reviews.title: Not a resort but a overpriced backpackers hostel
Great Getaway
reviews.text: Overpriced food.

reviews.title: Wouldn't stay again
reviews.text: Never stay here. It was a rip off for $155, it was old and disgusting with many mould mraks in the bath room, laundry was also the kitchen and the shower was all cramped and mouldy. The view of the lake was nice but the room was old and needed to be re vamped, kids were very disappointed. The pillows were also very old and needed to be changed.

reviews.title: Disgraceful conduct
reviews.text: My husband and I planned our tour of the south west of WA 8 months in advance. We booked a room at this establishment for two days and paid for our accommodation (in full). We were looking forward to staying here, as we had heard some lovely things about the place. Upon arrival, we were advised that there was no booking made in our name, yet we had a receipt and had received confirmation of our booking in writing. Management was totally uninterested in our situation and suggested that we would have to find alternative accommodation, and this on a Friday night. No offer of compensation, just a refund. Thankfully we found a nicer place nearby, offering self contained cottages for the same price as the old looking motel rooms at this so called resort. Talking to other travellers and business owners in the region (about our experience) we discovered that it was common policy for this establishment to "double book" because many of their guests cancelled at the last minute, this way they were always sure to be full.

reviews.title: Great place to stay
reviews.text: If this is true, then we are disgusted that they can conduct themselves in such an immoral fashion. We could have found ourselves with no where to stay and not even an apology from their management.

reviews.title: New Year Break
reviews.text: The alternative place we stayed at was by far nicer from what we could tell, with pleasant hosts and much newer facilities.

reviews.title: A True Forest Atmosphere
reviews.text: Please take heed and consider this a warning, that your booking with the karri valley resort is not secure and you could find yourself out on the street. We would suggest avoiding this place at all costs.

description: Karri Valley Resort is a 3.5 star family resort in a beautiful, natural forest setting. Choose from a self contained 2 or 3 bedroom rustic chalet or a hotel style room on the edge of the Lake. The setting is spectacular, amongst towering karri trees bordering trout filled Lake Beedelup. Kookaburras, kangaroos, emus – truly an Australian getaway. Activities and facilities include: Canoeing, trout fishing, mini golf, archery, tennis, feeding the farm animals, bush walks, restaurant, basic general store and bottle shop.We are situated in an area where we have no mobile phone or internet coverage, so you can really escape.
